alert.note: Alert for Coconino (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued July 23 at 6:22PM MST until July 23 at 7:30PM MST by NWS Flagstaff
info.description: The National Weather Service in Flagstaff has extended the * Flash Flood Warning for... The western portions of the Pipeline Burn Scar in Coconino County in north central Arizona... * Until 730 PM MST. * At 621 PM MST, At 505 PM MST, trained weather spotters reported flooding along Stevanna Way (west of Highway 180) in Flagstaff. Excessive rainfall over the burn scar will result in debris flow moving through the Schultz Creek. The debris flow can consist of rock, mud, vegetation and other loose materials. HAZARD...Life-threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding in and around the western portions of the Pipeline Burn Scar. SOURCE...Trained spotters reported. IMPACT...Life threatening flash flooding of areas in and around the Western portions of the Pipeline Burn Scar. This includes the following highways... Highway 180 between mile markers 218 and 219. This includes the following creeks, washes and rivers... Schultz Creek. FLASH FLOOD...OBSERVED FLASH FLOOD DAMAGE THREAT...CONSIDERABLE
info.instruction: Immediately move out of and away from creeks and washes in the Western portions of the Pipeline Burn Scar. Flash flooding is occurring or imminent. Turn Around, Don`t Drown if you encounter flood waters while driving. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
